intro: Micromeria ekmaniana, commonly known as the Desert Caper, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments, with succulent stems that store water. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the leaves and a compact growth habit, which help it conserve moisture. Micromeria ekmaniana is often found in rocky soils and is a component of desert ecosystems.
